Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Warmed, Humidified Carbon Dioxide in Open Abdominal Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: A single-blind randomised controlled trial was conducted

Participants.evidence: Patients aged 18 years and over scheduled for elective midline laparotomy were included

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received WHCO2 (37Â°C, 98% humidity), while the control group received standard care without gas insufflation

Objective.evidence: This study assessed the impact of warmed, humidified carbon dioxide (WHCO2) on peritoneal inflammation and oxidative damage during open abdominal surgery

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in peritoneal inflammation and damage markers from the start (T0) to the end (Tend) of surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using an online tool, with allocation concealed in opaque envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Patients and outcome assessors were blinded

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 40 patients randomised, 20 were allocated to WHCO2 and 19 to control

Result_Outcome.evidence: Significant differences in log(Tend/T0) were found for IL-2 (5.3 vs. 2.8; P=0.028) and IL-4 (3.5 vs. 2.0; P=0.041)

Harms.evidence: No significant differences were observed in other clinical outcomes or adverse events
